conclusion: Understanding the P-V diagram with two adiabatic and two isochoric processes.
The cycle is labeled a, b, c, d with arrows indicating direction: a to d to c to b to a.
The question asks if heat absorbed is greater than heat released during the cycle.
From a to d: Isochoric process, volume constant, pressure decreases.
From a to d: No work done, heat changes internal energy, Q < 0.
From d to c: Adiabatic process, pressure increases, volume increases slightly.
From d to c: Adiabatic process, Q = 0.
From c to b: Isochoric process, pressure increases significantly.
From c to b: No work done, heat absorbed, Q > 0.
From b to a: Adiabatic process, pressure decreases, volume decreases slightly.
From b to a: Adiabatic process, Q = 0.
First law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
For a complete cycle, ΔU = 0, so Q_total = W_total.
In a P-V diagram, work done is the area enclosed by the cycle.
Cycle is traversed clockwise: a to d, d to c, c to b, b to a.
Work done by the system is positive, so Q_total is positive.
Net Q_total = Q(c to b) + Q(a to d) + 0 + 0.
